page.title: 01ALSTON MOOR : 03680546
page.content: Alston Moor is a self-contained area of approximately sixty square miles , surrounded by the highest fells of the Pennine chain which form the water- shed of three major rivers,the South Tyne,Wear & Tees.The town of Alston stands 1,000 feet above sea level. Distance from other centres of population has encouraged self -sufficiency & Alston has a wide range of shops & independent amenities including the Cottage Hospital,Library & Post Office. Since the closure of the Alston Foundry,the major employer ,the town has looked to tourism & small industries. The surrounding fells are an attraction to walkers;the Pennine Way follows the course of the river South Tyne close to the town.The fells and lower lying pasture are used predominantly for sheep farming.
